Let the linear application $F: \mathbb{R}^3\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ be defined by $F(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, 2x+3y+z)$. 
The kernel, $ker(F)$, and the space image of $F$, $range(F)$, are respectively:

Find the solutions $\left(\text{in } \mathbb{C}^2\right)$ of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
(1+i)z& + & (1-i)w & = & i \\
(1-i)z& + & (1+i)w & = & 1-i
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The unique solution of the linear system is $\bigg(\frac{3+i}{4},-\frac{1+i}{4}\bigg)$.
answer2: The solutions of the linear system are of the form $\bigg(\frac{1+i}{4},\frac{-1+i}{4}+z\bigg)$, for every $z\in\mathbb{C}$.
answer3: The linear system has no solutions.
answer4: The linear system has the vector $(i,-i)$ has its unique solution.

question:
Consider $m \neq 0$. Make $x$ the subject of the expression

$y=mx+c$

Solve for $x$:

$3^x=5$

Solve for $x$:

$\frac{2x}{4}=3x^3$

Solve the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & 2y & - & 3z & + & w & = & -2 \\
3x & - & y & - & 2z & - & 4w & = & 1 \\
2x & + & 3y & - & 5z & + & w & = & -3 \\
x & + & y & - & z & + & w & = & -2
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(z+w,\,z-w-1,\,z,\,w\right)$ as solution for all $z,w\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,2,\,2,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(x,\,y,\,x+y,\,x-y-1\right)$ as solution for all $x,y\in\mathbb{R}$.

\end{array}
\]

& 3x_{1}+4x_{2}+5x_{3}+2x_{new} \leq 20 \text{ (resource 2)}\\
& x_{1}, x_{2}, x_{3}, x_{new} \geq 0\\ 
\end{array}
\]

question: Choose the right answer:
answer1: The rotation function  $F_\theta:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated with the  $\theta$ angle is an orthogonal linear operator
answer2: The translation function $F_v:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated to vector $v$ is a linear operator
answer3: The reflection function $F:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ around the line y = x, defined by $F(x,y)=(y, x)$ is a non-orthogonal linear operator
answer4: The rotation function  $F_\theta:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated with the  $\theta$ angle is a non-orthogonal linear operator

question:

$$\begin{array}{c|ccc}
x & 1 & 2 & 3   \\
\hline
y & 42 & 42.4 & 42.7 \\
\end{array} $$ 

Using Newton's polynomial, find the value of $P(1.5)$.

Solve the linear system
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & y & + & z & = & 1 \\
3x & - & y & - & z & = & 4 \\
x & + & 5y & + & 5z & = & -1
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(0,\,0,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(x,\,x,\,-2x+1\right)$ as solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(\frac{5}{4},\,y,\,z\right)$ as solution for every $y,z\in\mathbb{R}$.

question:
Find the solution of the following linear system: 
$$\begin{cases}
&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &5 \\
&5x &+ &3y &+ &2z &= &0 \\
& & &y &- &z &= &0
\end{cases}$$

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
6x & - & 11y & + & 2z & - & 9t & = & 2 \\
2x & + & y & - & 2z & - & t & = & 1 \\
x & - & 3y & + & z & - & 2t & = & -1
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(0,\,1,\,0,\,-1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(1+z,\,0,\,z,\,-z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(1-y,\,y,\,2+y,\,-y\right)$ as solution for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.

question: Consider the transformations $T:\cal{M}_{2\times 2}(\mathbb{R})\longrightarrow \mathbb{R}$. Mark the linear transformation.

Medical researchers analyze how different dosages of a drug affect the duration of relief from allergic symptoms. They want to develop a statistical model to predict the time of relief (in days) based on the dosage of a new drug. Identify the predictor variable and the response variable.
answer1: The predictor variable is a dosage of a new drug; the response variable is the time of relief.
answer2: The predictor variable is the time of relief; the response variable is the dosage of the new drug.
answer3: The predictor variable is the mean of time of relief; the response variable is the mean of dosage of the new drug.
answer4: The predictor variable is the mean of dosage of a new drug; the response variable is the mean of time of relief.

question: Consider the vectors $u=(-1, 2, 3)$ and $v=(0, 1, 1)$ of $\mathbb{R}^3$. The cross product $u\times v$ is:
answer1: A vector that is normal to the plane containing $u$ and $v$ with norm $\sqrt{3}$.
answer2: A vector parallel to $u$ and $v$ with norm $\sqrt{3}$.
answer3: A vector that is perpendicular to both $u$ and $v$ with norm $2\sqrt{7}$ .
answer4: A vector parallel to $u$ and $v$ with norm $2\sqrt{7}$.
